title: Matchsafe, "Valise", 1883–84
markings: G.U. date letter "i", anchor, lion passant, illegible mark (probably duty mark) all stamped on front; date letter "i" and duty mark stamped on underside of lid.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, curved sides, top and bottom, resembling a valise with leather straps that wrap from front to back, buckles on each strap on both sides, front features incised decoration of leaf motif, shield reserve at center inscribed "From [illegible monogram]", part just above strap opens as lid, hinged on side, thumb catch opposite, top of lid inscribed "A. Huttenback, 20th July, 1884." Same leaf motif with flowers at center incised on reverse. Striker on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Valise", 1883–84.
1883–84. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1982-23-1139.
